isis.stitle: TSI 98-12-15 - The Diamond Logic™ Engine Control Module (ECM) control software calibration may cause an engine surge when the engine is operated under a light load or in the 1000 - 1300 rpm range or both.

subjectgroup.subject: The Diamond Logic™ Engine Control Module (ECM) control software calibration may cause an engine surge when the engine is operated under a light load or in the 1000 - 1300 rpm range or both.

note.para: Diamond Logic™ was formerly known as NavPak® or single box controller.

geninfo.para: The engine surge condition affects all International T 444E diesel engines, equipped with the Diamond Logic™ ECM, having Serial Numbers ranging from 634234 through 748353.

Under certain operating conditions and depending upon vehicle configurations, the Diamond Logic™ ECM control software can cause the engine to surge when operated under a light load or when the engine is running in the 1000 - 1300 rpm range during Power Take-Off (PTO) operation or both. However, this condition might not be apparent on all vehicles. A software calibration release is available which will fix this condition, should it be calibrated related.

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: Two different calibration reference numbers, which were used during engine production, can exhibit the engine surge condition.
Starting with engine serial number 748354 and UP: service calibration reference number PRC2AF01 replaced PRC2AF00. This resolved the engine surge condition for the remaining 1998 model year engines.

Engines with serial numbers 634234 through 748353: service calibration is handled on reference number PRC2AF03. This service calibration takes care of all 1997 model year engines with serial number 634234 and UP and 1998 model year engines with serial number SN 748353 and Below.

note.para: The calibration reference number is located on any Diamond Logic™ ECM. The number can be viewed by using the EZ TECH tool and accessing the Vehicle View Information menu with the Master Diagnostics program.

important.para: THE CALIBRATION REFERENCE NUMBER SHOULD BE VERIFIED BEFORE RE-PROGRAMMING IS ATTEMPTED AND AFTER RE-PROGRAMMING IS COMPLETED TO INSURE CORRECT CALIBRATION.

svcproc.title: PARTS AFFECTED
svcproc.para:
No service parts are required to perform this service calibration. Refer to T 444E With Diamond Logic™ ECM Calibration Reference Number
which indicates the service calibrations available through the NETS/AFC system.

table.title: T 444E With Diamond Logic™ ECM Calibration Reference Number

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Instructions on how to remotely re-program the Diamond Logic™ ECM, through the NETS/AFC 1.4 system, is provided in the instructions attached to AFC G-98903 - Revised.

important.para: THIS IS NOT A SERVICE CAMPAIGN, THE INCIDENT OF THIS CONDITION IS VERY LOW.

note.para: Reference G-98903 - Revised, Authorized Field Change for detailed instructions for re-programming of the Diamond Logic™ ECM. This procedure can only be performed by a Navistar Dealer.

important.para: TO PERFORM THIS PROCEDURE THE EZ-TECH SERVICE TOOL MUST BE USED. THERE IS NO WAY TO RE-PROGRAM THE ECM WITHOUT USING THE EZ-TECH TOOL. IF YOU DO NOT HAVE THIS TOOL AVAILABLE, IT CAN BE OBTAINED BY CONTACTING:
